info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 3:28PM MDT until May 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, south central Arapahoe.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, centered over an area from 6 miles south of Bennett to 8 miles south of Byers. This may cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Comanche Creek, Comanche Creek, Wolf Creek, Rattlesnake Creek, West Bijou Creek and Kiowa Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mainly rural areas of South Central Arapahoe County south of Bennett, Strasburg, and Byers.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING
